meanings.definition: A characteristic mode of vibration of a system
meanings.sent1: The eigenmodes of the guitar strings determine the sound they produce.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the eigenmodes of buildings to understand their structural stability.
meanings.sent3: The eigenmodes of the bouncy castle seemed to have a dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The eigenmodes of the pendulum swung in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The eerie hum of the eigenmodes filled the room, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A pattern of oscillation in a physical system
meanings.sent1: The eigenmodes of the swing set showed different ways it could move.
meanings.sent2: The eigenmodes of the earthquake revealed its complex shaking patterns.
meanings.sent3: The eigenmodes of the slinky toy seemed to have a secret rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The eigenmodes of the ocean waves danced gracefully along the shore.
meanings.sent5: The playground was filled with laughter as kids explored the eigenmodes of the seesaw.

meanings.definition: A fundamental frequency of a system
meanings.sent1: The eigenmodes of the flute determine its basic pitch.
meanings.sent2: Musicians adjust the eigenmodes of the drum to create different tones.
meanings.sent3: The eigenmodes of the car engine seemed to sing a low, steady tune.
meanings.sent4: The eigenmodes of the forest whispered a calming melody.
meanings.sent5: The eigenmodes of the bell tower rang out across the town, marking the hour.
